Text.val: If no data exists in the Address table, then create it.

Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}{\f1\fswiss\fprq2\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue128;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.21.2509;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\cf1\b\f0\fs20 When you do a \cf2 Link Query\cf1 , the Condition on the Link determines whether or not the link is actually done. If the Condition evaluates to No, then the linked record is not fetched. \par \par By default, this Condition is re-evaluated every time a new Main record is fetched. This keeps the Linked record syncronized with the Main record.\par \par However, there may be times where you only want to evaluate the Link the first time the Task starts. In that case, you can set the Link Evaluate property to Task. The Link Condition will then only be evaluated once, when the task starts.\par \par In this example, there are two subtasks. Each has a set of child records that link to a parent record. Whether or not the parent record is fetched is controlled by the "Fetch Name" checkbox.\par \par When the\cf2 Evaluate Link \cf1 property is set to Record, on the \i\f1 Record\i0\f0 tab, checking the box allows the link to happen, and you'll see the fetched parent record. However, on the \i\f1 Task\i0\f0 tab, checking the box has no effect, because the task has already started and the Condition will not be re-evaluated.\par }
